page.title: 03The Manor House,Breamore
page.content: This imposing Elizabethan manor continues to be the focal point in the tranquil and picturesque village of Breamore. It was built by the {Dodington}family in 1583 and purchased in the eighteenth century by the{Hulse family,physicians to royalty.It remains the home of the{Hulse}family today,in addition to being a major tourist attraction and a source of employment for the village people. Set in magnificent grounds overlooking the northern boundary of the New Forest,it contains a fine collection of furniture,17th century Dutch paintings and tapestries by David Teniers.Two paintings are of particular note;one of Christine Dodington,Breamore's{ghost,}and one early cricket scene,'Boy with Cricket Bat' whose twin hangs at Lords.
